info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued July 18 at 2:42AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .DISCUSSION...Mostly sunny skies are expected today with highs from 95 to 110 degrees. Minimum afternoon relative humidities will drop 12 to 22 percent. South to southwest winds will average 10-25 mph over southern South Dakota. South winds over northwest South Dakota will become northwest late averaging 10-20 mph. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The grassland fire danger index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. The outlook for Tuesday afternoon, The grassland fire danger index will reach the very high category to extreme category.
